page.title: 10THE VILLAGE OF BURITON
page.content: {Landscape and Buildings:}The village is basically the same as it was in the 17th Century with ribbon development along the roads radiating from the Church, Manor House and Pond. Many of the old buildings remain and are built of white malmstone with brick dressing. A large number of buildings are on the Statutory and Supplementary lists of Special Architectural Historic Interest. The oldest building is St Mary's Church which has a 12th Century nave and 13th Century chancel. Parts of the old Rectory are 14th Century but the building has been altered. The Manor House, adjacent to the church, has parts dating from the 16th Century. These buildings plus the houses along the High Street, Bones Lane and North Lane form a 'Conservation' Area.
